intro: Hedyotis ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a low herb with small, oval-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Hedyotis ovalis is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and its ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
